page.title: 02SAND QUARRY II.
page.content: Once the sand has been cleaned and dried, in a large diesel-fired drier, it is made into{RESIN-COATED SAND. Metal industries use this to make castings by pouring molten{BRASS}or {STEEL,}for example,into pre-shaped {"Formers".}The resin and a hardening agent is mixed with the sand.The resin melts and coats every grain of sand. This makes the sand thermo-setting(it hardens when heated) and it can be bonded to make very comlex moulds. Resins,like Austrian Zircon,can make different types of coated sand to suit a particular kind of job. The finished{RESIN-COATED SAND}is sold to foundries mainly in{TYNESIDE, {WEST YORKSHIRE,THE MIDLANDS}and {LEICESTER,}although there is a market in{SCANDINAVIA.}The cost of a ton of coated sand varies according to the amount of treatment it receives.
